parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

datasetStructure: One record per recorded intervention occurrence or constant-dosing interval per subject

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable CM.STUDYID

datasetVariables.description: Unique identifier for a study.
datasetVariables.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariables.name: STUDYID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable CM.DOMAIN

datasetVariables.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
datasetVariables.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariables.name: DOMAIN

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable CM.USUBJID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
datasetVariables.label: Unique Subject Identifier
datasetVariables.name: USUBJID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable CM.CMSEQ

datasetVariables.description: Sequence Number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.
datasetVariables.label: Sequence Number
datasetVariables.name: CMSEQ

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable CM.CMGRPID

datasetVariables.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.
datasetVariables.label: Group ID
datasetVariables.name: CMGRPID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable CM.CMSPID

datasetVariables.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. Examples: a number pre-printed on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or record identifier defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: line number on a concomitant medication page.
datasetVariables.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
datasetVariables.name: CMSPID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

priorVersion.title: Reported Name of Drug, Med, or Therapy

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable CM.CMTRT

self.title: Reported Name of Drug, Med, or Therapy

datasetVariables.description: Verbatim medication name that is either pre-printed or collected on a CRF.
datasetVariables.label: Reported Name of Drug, Med, or Therapy
datasetVariables.name: CMTRT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable CM.CMMODIFY

datasetVariables.description: If CMTRT is modified to facilitate coding, then CMMODIFY will contain the modified text.
datasetVariables.label: Modified Reported Name
datasetVariables.name: CMMODIFY

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable CM.CMDECOD

datasetVariables.description: Standardized or dictionary-derived text description of CMTRT or CMMODIFY. Equivalent to the generic medication name in WHO Drug. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the define.xml external codelist attributes. If an intervention term does not have a decode value in the dictionary then CMDECOD will be left blank.
datasetVariables.label: Standardized Medication Name
datasetVariables.name: CMDECOD

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable CM.CMCAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to define a category of medications/treatments. Examples: PRIOR, CONCOMITANT, ANTI-CANCER MEDICATION, or GENERAL CONMED.
datasetVariables.label: Category for Medication
datasetVariables.name: CMCAT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable CM.CMSCAT

datasetVariables.description: A further categorization of medications/ treatment. Examples: CHEMOTHERAPY, HORMONAL THERAPY, ALTERNATIVE THERAPY.
datasetVariables.label: Subcategory for Medication
datasetVariables.name: CMSCAT

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable CM.CMPRESP

datasetVariables.description: Used to indicate whether (Y/null) information about the use of a specific medication was solicited on the CRF.
datasetVariables.label: CM Pre-Specified
datasetVariables.name: CMPRESP

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable CM.CMOCCUR

datasetVariables.description: When the use of specific medications is solicited, CMOCCUR is used to indicate whether or not (Y/N) use of the medication occurred. Values are null for medications not specifically solicited.
datasetVariables.label: CM Occurrence
datasetVariables.name: CMOCCUR

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66789

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable CM.CMSTAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to indicate that a question about a pre-specified medication was not answered. Should be null or have a value of NOT DONE.
datasetVariables.label: Completion Status
datasetVariables.name: CMSTAT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable CM.CMREASND

datasetVariables.description: Describes the reason concomitant medication was not collected. Used in conjunction with CMSTAT when value is NOT DONE.
datasetVariables.label: Reason Medication Not Collected
datasetVariables.name: CMREASND

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable CM.CMINDC

datasetVariables.description: Denotes why a medication was taken or administered. Examples: NAUSEA, HYPERTENSION.
datasetVariables.label: Indication
datasetVariables.name: CMINDC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable CM.CMCLAS

datasetVariables.description: Drug class. May be obtained from coding. When coding to a single class, populate with class value. If using a dictionary and coding to multiple classes, then follow Section 4: 4.1.2.8.3, Multiple Values For A Non-Result Qualifier Variable or omit CMCLAS.
datasetVariables.label: Medication Class
datasetVariables.name: CMCLAS

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable CM.CMCLASCD

datasetVariables.description: Class code corresponding to CMCLAS. Drug class. May be obtained from coding. When coding to a single class, populate with class code. If using a dictionary and coding to multiple classes, then follow Section 4: 4.1.2.8.3, Multiple Values For A Non-Result Qualifier Variable or omit CMCLASCD.
datasetVariables.label: Medication Class Code
datasetVariables.name: CMCLASCD

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable CM.CMDOSE

datasetVariables.description: Amount of CMTRT taken. Not populated when CMDOSTXT is populated.
datasetVariables.label: Dose per Administration
datasetVariables.name: CMDOSE

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable CM.CMDOSTXT

datasetVariables.description: Dosing amounts or a range of dosing information collected in text form. Units may be stored in CMDOSU. Example: 200-400, 15-20. Not populated when CMDOSE is populated.
datasetVariables.label: Dose Description
datasetVariables.name: CMDOSTXT

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable CM.CMDOSU

datasetVariables.description: Units for CMDOSE, CMDOSTOT, and CMDOSTXT. Examples: ng, mg, or mg/kg.
datasetVariables.label: Dose Units
datasetVariables.name: CMDOSU

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66726

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable CM.CMDOSFRM

datasetVariables.description: Dose form for CMTRT. Examples: TABLET, LOTION.
datasetVariables.label: Dose Form
datasetVariables.name: CMDOSFRM

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71113

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable CM.CMDOSFRQ

datasetVariables.description: Usually expressed as the number of repeated administrations of CMDOSE within a specific time period. Examples: BID (twice daily), Q12H (every 12 hours).
datasetVariables.label: Dosing Frequency per Interval
datasetVariables.name: CMDOSFRQ

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable CM.CMDOSTOT

datasetVariables.description: Total daily dose of CMTRT using the units in CMDOSU. Used when dosing is collected as Total Daily Dose. Total dose over a period other than day could be recorded in a separate Supplemental Qualifier variable.
datasetVariables.label: Total Daily Dose
datasetVariables.name: CMDOSTOT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable CM.CMDOSRGM

datasetVariables.description: Text description of the (intended) schedule or regimen for the Intervention. Examples: TWO WEEKS ON, TWO WEEKS OFF.
datasetVariables.label: Intended Dose Regimen
datasetVariables.name: CMDOSRGM

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66729

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable CM.CMROUTE

datasetVariables.description: Route of administration for CMTRT. Examples: ORAL, INTRAVENOUS.
datasetVariables.label: Route of Administration
datasetVariables.name: CMROUTE

datasetVariables.name: CMENDY

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable CM.CMDUR

datasetVariables.description: Collected duration for a treatment episode. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived from start and end date/times.
datasetVariables.label: Duration of Medication
datasetVariables.name: CMDUR

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66728

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable CM.CMSTRF

datasetVariables.description: Describes the start of the medication relative to sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point (represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics). If information such as "PRIOR", ONGOING or "CONTINUING" was collected, this information may be translated into CMSTRF.
datasetVariables.label: Start Relative to Reference Period
datasetVariables.name: CMSTRF

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66728

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable CM.CMENRF

datasetVariables.description: Describes the end of the medication relative to the sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point (represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics). If information such as "PRIOR", "ONGOING, or "CONTINUING" was collected, this information may be translated into CMENRF.
datasetVariables.label: End Relative to Reference Period
datasetVariables.name: CMENRF

datasetVariables.name: CMSTRTPT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable CM.CMSTTPT

datasetVariables.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the reference point referred to by CMSTRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-15" or "VISIT 1".
datasetVariables.label: Start Reference Time Point
datasetVariables.name: CMSTTPT

datasetVariables.name: CMENRTPT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable CM.CMENTPT

datasetVariables.label: End Reference Time Point
datasetVariables.name: CMENTPT

description: An interventions domain that contains concomitant and prior medications used by the subject, such as those given on an as needed basis or condition-appropriate medications. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C49568, 2018-06-29)
label: Concomitant Medications
name: CM
